I got this set used after it was retired.
column2: Being born in the 70s, I remember seeing all these sets in the stores, but I never owned any of them.&nbsp
column3: I never had these sets on my wish list, but I did admire them. This set scratches that itch of having suitably small replacements for the originals without spending lots of money.

column1: Monorail - I do remember seeing it on display at Toys R Us and being a bit mesmerized.
column2: This build is decent, but the weakest of them all.&nbsp
column3: It would be almost unrecognizable if you did not know the source material.&nbsp
column4: Despite that, it does capture lots of good details.

column1: Castle - Some working features (such as working draw bridge and hinged towers) make this set strong.
column2: Weaknesses include lack of detail on the tower tops and the back doors do not actually open, despite being hinged.&nbsp

column1: Galaxy Explorer - Maybe the best looking of the 4 builds.
column2: Quite a well detailed build, even down to the moon base with crater plate, landing plate, and rover.&nbsp
column3: The ship looks great, despite the scale.&nbsp
column4: No hinged back, which can be forgiven considering it is only a 4 stud wide build.&nbsp
column5: Any classic space fan will know this build from a distance.

column1: Pirate ship - I had a friend with the original, but I was never into pirates.
column2: Lots of good details here, including sails, cannons, flags, railings.&nbsp
column3: The body shape is a little off.&nbsp
column4: But, a half stud offset makes the poop deck fit nicely.&nbsp
column5: The only real concern is that the masts allow for the sails to spin around with gravity.&nbsp
column6: I just put some 4L rods inside them to keep them stiff.

column1: Other thoughts - There is a simple brick display as well.
column2: It is not very interesting and only serves to remind you that this was a commemorative set.

column1: Parts are pretty easy to source, making it easy to make any of the models on your own.
Monorail is lack luster, but well done.
A really nice set that offers multiple builds at a low cost.
column2: The builds look great and really capture the source material, including some small details.&nbsp
